Just by searching email validations on google you'll find stack overflow post with massive amount of different approaches to this problem. And you'll probably be as confused as I was. Do I use this massive regex from RFC something standard? Or just simple regex? Or some package from npm?

One regex to rule them all...

(?:(?:\r\n)?[ \t])*(?:(?:(?:[^()<>@,;:\\".\[\] \000-\031]+(?:(?:(?:\r\n)?[ \t]
)+|\Z|(?=[\["()<>@,;:\\".\[\]]))|"(?:[^\"\r\\]|\\.|(?:(?:\r\n)?[ \t]))*"(?:(?:

"()<>@,;:\\".\[\]]))|"(?:[^\"\r\\]|\\.|(?:(?:\r\n)?[ \t]))*"(?:(?:\r\n)?[ \t])
*))*@(?:(?:\r\n)?[ \t])*(?:[^()<>@,;:\\".\[\] \000-\031]+(?:(?:(?:\r\n)?[ \t])
+|\Z|(?=[\["()<>@,;:\\".\[\]]))|\[([^\[\]\r\\]|\\.)*\](?:(?:\r\n)?[ \t])*)(?:\
.(?:(?:\r\n)?[ \t])*(?:[^()<>@,;:\\".\[\] \000-\031]+(?:(?:(?:\r\n)?[ \t])+|\Z
|(?=[\["()<>@,;:\\".\[\]]))|\[([^\[\]\r\\]|\\.)*\](?:(?:\r\n)?[ \t])*))*\>(?:(
?:\r\n)?[ \t])*))*)?;\s*)

I am sorry, but this is a thing. Of course, I am kidding. You don't have to use this gigantic block of regex. Here is simple one that will do it for virtually every use case. It's not prone to bugs where @.@.@.@ is validated like some other short ones.

/^[^\s@]+@[^\s@]+\.[^\s@]+$/

While this will do for mere mortals, there is other option for cool JavaScript kids.

Let's increase our bundle size!

Yes, you got that right! Other opinion is to install package from npm!

npm install validator

Congrats, your bundle will love it!

Also, make sure to import it like this so your fancy tree-shaker doesn't need to shake too much.

import isEmail from 'validator/lib/isEmail'

And that's it. Who would say that you can validate email in this many ways!
